info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on entities like API, Product, and Subscription associated with your Azure API Management deployment.

get.description: Lists all the Global Policy definitions of the Api Management service.

properties.policyContent:
<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - Only the <forward-request> policy element can appear within the <backend> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy position the cursor at the desired insertion point and click on the round button associated with the policy.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
-->
<policies>
  <inbound />
  <backend>
    <forward-request />
  </backend>
  <outbound />
</policies>

200.description: Returns an array of Policy Contracts.

    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - Only the <forward-request> policy element can appear within the <backend> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.

code.description: Service-defined error code. This code serves as a sub-status for the HTTP error code specified in the response.

details.description: The list of invalid fields send in request, in case of validation error.

PolicyCollection.description: The response of the list policy operation.

policyContent.description: Xml Encoded contents of the Policy.

PolicySnippetsCollection.description: The response of the list policy snippets operation.

scope.description: Binary OR value of the Snippet scope.

isMasterRegion.description: whether Region is the master region.

count.description: Total record count number across all pages.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group.

ServiceNameParameter.name: serviceName
ServiceNameParameter.description: The name of the API Management service.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
